name: Married couple filing jointly (â‚¬50,000)
description: Married couple filing jointly with quociente conjugal (spousal quotient), verified against Portuguese IRS calculation method

sources.description: Manual calculation using 2025 IRS brackets with quociente conjugal (quotient of 2)
sources.notes: Married joint filing divides income by quotient of 2: 50000/2=25000 per quotient. IRS calculated on 25000, then multiplied by 2. IRS per quotient: 4837.96; Total IRS: 9675.92; Social Security: 50000*0.11=5500; Net: 34824.08. This demonstrates tax benefit of joint filing vs single.
